comments:
When trying to open the standalone Help using the command line
call, as documented in the "Installing the stand-alone help
system", I get the following:

java -classpath F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help_2.1.0\help.jar
 org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -command displayHelp
java.io.IOException: CreateProcess: F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse -nosplash -applicat
ion org.eclipse.help.helpApplication -vm "C:\Program Files\Java\j2re1.4.1_01\bin
\javaw.exe" error=5
        at java.lang.Win32Process.create(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Win32Process.<init>(Win32Process.java:63)
        at java.lang.Runtime.execInternal(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:566)
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.Eclipse.run(Eclipse.java:36)

Do you get a similar error when your java is installed in a directory without 
blanks ?

yes ----

java.io.IOException: CreateProcess: F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse -nosplash -applicat
ion org.eclipse.help.helpApplication -vm e:\jdk\jre\bin\javaw.exe error=5
        at java.lang.Win32Process.create(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Win32Process.<init>(Win32Process.java:63)
        at java.lang.Runtime.execInternal(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:566)
        at org.eclipse.help.internal.standalone.Eclipse.run(Eclipse.java:36)

What is the command you are executing, and what is the current directory?
What jre are you using?
Does the file F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse.exe exist?
Does the file e:\jdk\jre\bin\javaw.exe exist?
Can you manually launch the command:
F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse -nosplash -application 
org.eclipse.help.helpApplication -vm e:\jdk\jre\bin\javaw.exe 
?  What happens?  If it works you will later need to kill the eclipse.exe and 
javaw.exe processes.
Thanks.

On the version of java:
  d:\copy-►java -version
  java version "1.4.1_01"
  Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.4.1_01-b01)
  Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.4.1_01-b01, mixed mode)

The command is:
java -classpath f:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help_2.1.0\help.jar
 org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -command displayHelp

but I've tried various others, javaw, -command start, etc.  Basically I just
copied the command from the instll instructions into a bat file and changed the
paths.

I'm running it from f:\imsinfoc21new; the eclipse directory is rignt below that,
and it has eclipse.exe in it.  I can run eclipse.exe (and the Help works).  I
also wrote a little Java app (one window, sorta like the one you get from
standalone main() ) and Help works from it.

I tried the command:
  F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse\eclipse -nosplash -application
org.eclipse.help.helpApplication -vm e:\jdk\jre\bin\javaw.exe 

eclipse never came up, however eclipse.exe and javaw.exe were running.  When I
killed javaw, it said it treminated in eclipse startup.jar Load something or other.

Fairly weird, huh . . . .

The docs say:
"-eclipsehome eclipseInstallPath - specifies Eclipse installation directory. It 
must be provided, when current directory from which infocenter is launched, is 
not the same as Eclipse installation directory. "

In your case it is F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse, not F:\imsinfoc21new.  Try 
changing the current directory or adding this option to your command.

Let us know if the docs are confusing, and need to be reworded.

Thanks.

The docs were also saying:
"A simple way to display help is to invoke
java -classpath d:\myApp\eclipse\plugins\org.eclipse.help_2.1.0\help.jar 
org.eclipse.help.standalone.Help -command displayHelp
from within d:\myApp directory."
which i wrong.
It should have said d:\myApp\eclipse.  I have corrected that example and added 
more explanation for the -eclipsehome option.

Ahhhh . . . specifying the eclipsehome flag worked. Thanks; sorry for the 
inconvenience. You can close this as User Error

It would be nice if:

   1) It might display an error something like :Gee, I can't find eclipde home" 
rather than throwing the CreateProcess exception.  That was misleading.

    2) The example could include a mention of using -eclipsehome.

I have added code to check for java and eclipse executable, and for startup.jar 
if -noexec is passed.  The exception will still be printed if launched from 
wrong directory, but it will not be launch process exception.  The message will 
say to pass correct eclipsehome option.

traces.message: CreateProcess: F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse -nosplash -applicat ion org.eclipse.help.helpApplication -vm "C:\Program Files\Java\j2re1.4.1_01\bin \javaw.exe" error=5
CreateProcess: F:\imsinfoc21new\eclipse -nosplash -applicat ion org.eclipse.help.helpApplication -vm e:\jdk\jre\bin\javaw.exe error=5
